title: Subhojitâ€™s Academic Journey
text:
Where do my interest lie?
I am an ardent admirer of the complex modal architecture of Raags and their nuanced affective properties, from the therapeutic cadences of Yaman to the devotional dichotomy of the Bhairavs. A reverence starkly belied by my own vocal deficiencies.
A similar analytical proclivity drives my deconstruction of theological frameworks, approached without dogmatic adherence. My own convictions are empirical and mutable, yet this objective lens consistently reveals a unifying tenet across scriptures: magnanimous inclusivity. ğŸ˜„


When should you contact me? ğŸ˜‰
Let discourse reside solely in mathematicsâ€”rigor as truth, clarity as beauty, elegance as law. The coffee function endures only as jest. Let the first vector be cast, and the sequence of ideas unfold without bound.

title: LaTeX Styling
text:
Story Time ğŸ˜
I had to work on the UDGRP Projects of Winter 2024 and there I had to use a lot of latex and make Beamer files and Latex Notes and while there were ample number of templates on OverLeaf but it seemed too boring and it lacked the personal touch I wanted to give to my presentations. So, I decided to create my own sty theme and customize it according to my preferences. ğŸ˜„

title: LaTeX Styling
text:
FAQ ğŸ˜•

Q. How do I use them ?
Primarily crafted for the mathematically inclined ğŸ§ , this toolset is ideal for penning articles and books on Mathematics and its mischievous offspring, Applied Mathematics (aka Physics) ğŸ’¥. No offense to any field, of course! ğŸ˜‡ Physics, bless its chaotic heart â¤ï¸, keeps mathematicians on their toes with its constant demand for elegant solutions to messy real-world problems ğŸ¤¯. Otherwise, weâ€™d all be stuck proving theorems in a vacuum ğŸ•³ï¸, and frankly, that sounds terribly dull ğŸ˜´.






ğŸš€ Simple Steps to Get Started






1. Download the Files
Head over to the GitHub repository and download the .sty files. You can either clone the repository or directly download the files you need.


2. Place the Files in Your Project
Move the .sty files to the same directory as your LaTeX project (where your .tex file resides) or a folder included in your LaTeX path.


3. Include the .sty Files in Your Document
To use the .sty file, include it in your LaTeX document with the \usepackage command.
Example Files - - - GitHub repository










ğŸ’¡ Pro Tip





If youâ€™re frequently using these .sty files, consider adding them to your LaTeX distributionâ€™s local path for easy access across all your projects.
